intro: Ixonanthes cuneata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in umbels. Its leaves are narrow and often have a distinctive, slightly hairy texture. Ixonanthes cuneata is typically found in sandy or disturbed soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
